channel.title: Jacob M. Maronge
channel.description: Recent content on Jacob M. Maronge

item.description: Hi, I’m Jake! I am a 3rd year PhD student in the Department of Statistics at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. I am working with Paul Rathouz on outcome-dependent sampling for longitudinal studies. In addition, I collaborate closely with the Wisconsin Intelligibility, Speech, and Communication Laboratory. Also, I’m really excited to be a Morse Scholar. My Morse Society Webpage can be seen here. I received my MS in Biostatistics from the Louisiana State University Health Sciences Center School of Public Health, where I worked with Zhide Fang on optimal designs of experiments.

item.title: Optimal designs for spline wavelet regression models
Single Cell RNA Sequencing: Analysis and Applications
Reproducibility and bias in healthy brain segmentation: comparison of two popular neuroimaging platforms
Introducing medals
item.description: Introducing medals Please take a look at the medals vignette! install.packages("devtools") library(devtools) install_github("jmmaronge/medals") library(medals) vignette(topic="medals_vignette",package="medals")

item.title: Introduction/doing prcomp() more efficiently
item.description: Introduction/doing prcomp() more efficiently Hi everyone! In my head, this blog will serve a couple purposes. The first, will be so that as I develop R code/packages, I can introduce them here and do short tutorials on how they work. This will be both for my own benefit, and the benefit of others (ideally) who are interested in what Iâ€™m working on. Second, it will be a collection of short statistics/R topics that I go through that, for whatever reason, I have a hard time getting straight in my head.
